declarations.comments: Tests whether or not the arguments have approximately the same value, within an absolute or relative tolerance of glMatrix.EPSILON (an absolute tolerance is used for values less than or equal to 1.0, and a relative tolerance is used for larger values)
declarations.title: equals

declarations.comments:
Set the (internally matrix array type). `MatrixArrayTypeArray` is highly recommended,
otherwise the API is not correct (`Number` vs `Float32`), and you'll run into trouble
sooner or later, although all tests run with both types successfully.

The default is `MatrixArrayTypeFloat32Array`.
declarations.title: setMatrixArrayType

declarations.comments: Uses `equal` to check that all numbers in the given arrays are approximately the same.

declarations.comments: Creates a matrix from a given angle around a given axis This is equivalent to (but much faster than): mat4.identity(dest); mat4.rotate(dest, dest, rad, axis);
declarations.title: fromRotation

declarations.comments: Creates a matrix from a vector scaling This is equivalent to (but much faster than): mat4.identity(dest); mat4.scale(dest, dest, vec);
declarations.title: fromScaling

declarations.title: fromTranslation

declarations.title: fromValues

declarations.comments: Creates a matrix from the given angle around the X axis This is equivalent to (but much faster than): mat4.identity(dest); mat4.rotateX(dest, dest, rad);
declarations.title: fromXRotation

declarations.comments: Creates a matrix from the given angle around the Y axis This is equivalent to (but much faster than): mat4.identity(dest); mat4.rotateY(dest, dest, rad);
declarations.title: fromYRotation

declarations.comments: Creates a matrix from the given angle around the Z axis This is equivalent to (but much faster than): mat4.identity(dest); mat4.rotateZ(dest, dest, rad);
declarations.title: fromZRotation

declarations.title: frustum

declarations.comments: Returns the scaling factor component of a transformation matrix. If a matrix is built with fromRotationTranslationScale with a normalized Quaternion paramter, the returned vector will be the same as the scaling vector originally supplied.
declarations.title: getScaling

declarations.comments: Returns the translation vector component of a transformation matrix. If a matrix is built with fromRotationTranslation, the returned vector will be the same as the translation vector originally supplied.
declarations.title: getTranslation

declarations.comments: Set a Mat4 to the identity matrix
declarations.title: identity

declarations.comments: Inverts a Mat4
declarations.title: invert

declarations.comments: Generates a look-at matrix with the given eye position, focal point, and up axis. If you want a matrix that actually makes an object look at another object, you should use targetTo instead.
declarations.title: lookAt

declarations.comments: Multiplies two Mat4's
declarations.title: multiply

declarations.comments: Multiply each element of the matrix by a scalar

declarations.comments: Generates a orthogonal projection matrix with the given bounds
declarations.title: ortho

declarations.comments: Generates a perspective projection matrix with the given bounds. Passing null/undefined/no value for far will generate infinite projection matrix.
declarations.title: perspective

declarations.comments: Generates a perspective projection matrix with the given field of view. This is primarily useful for generating projection matrices to be used with the still experiemental WebVR API.
declarations.title: perspectiveFromFieldOfView

declarations.comments: Rotates a mat4 by the given angle around the given axis
declarations.title: rotate

declarations.title: rotateX

declarations.comments: Rotates a matrix by the given angle around the Y axis
declarations.title: rotateY

declarations.comments: Rotates a matrix by the given angle around the Z axis

declarations.title: scale

declarations.comments: Subtracts matrix b from matrix a
declarations.title: subtract

declarations.comments: Generates a matrix that makes something look at something else.
declarations.title: targetTo

declarations.comments: Calculates a 4x4 matrix from the given quaternion
declarations.title: fromQuat

declarations.comments: Creates a matrix from a quaternion rotation and vector translation This is equivalent to (but much faster than): mat4.identity(dest); mat4.translate(dest, vec); let quatMat = mat4.create(); quat4.toMat4(quat, quatMat); mat4.multiply(dest, quatMat);
declarations.title: fromRotationTranslation

declarations.comments: Creates a matrix from a quaternion rotation, vector translation and vector scale This is equivalent to (but much faster than): mat4.identity(dest); mat4.translate(dest, vec); let quatMat = mat4.create(); quat4.toMat4(quat, quatMat); mat4.multiply(dest, quatMat); mat4.scale(dest, scale)
declarations.title: fromRotationTranslationScale

declarations.comments: Creates a matrix from a quaternion rotation, vector translation and vector scale, rotating and scaling around the given origin This is equivalent to (but much faster than): mat4.identity(dest); mat4.translate(dest, vec); mat4.translate(dest, origin); let quatMat = mat4.create(); quat4.toMat4(quat, quatMat); mat4.multiply(dest, quatMat); mat4.scale(dest, scale) mat4.translate(dest, negativeOrigin);
declarations.title: fromRotationTranslationScaleOrigin

declarations.comments: Returns a quaternion representing the rotational component of a transformation matrix. If a matrix is built with fromRotationTranslation, the returned quaternion will be the same as the quaternion originally supplied.
declarations.title: getRotation

declarations.comments: Returns whether or not the quaternions have approximately the same elements in the same position.
declarations.title: equals

declarations.comments: Returns whether or not the quaternions have exactly the same elements in the same position (when compared with ===)
declarations.title: exactEquals

declarations.comments: Calculates the length of a quat
declarations.title: length

declarations.comments: Performs a spherical linear interpolation with two control points
declarations.title: sqlerp

declarations.comments: Adds two quat's
declarations.title: add

declarations.comments: Calculates the W component of a quat from the X, Y, and Z components. Assumes that quaternion is 1 unit in length. Any existing W component will be ignored.
declarations.title: calculateW

declarations.comments: Calculates the conjugate of a quat If the quaternion is normalized, this function is faster than quat.inverse and produces the same result.
declarations.title: conjugate

declarations.comments: Calculates the dot product of two quat's
declarations.title: dot

declarations.comments: Calculate the exponential of a unit quaternion.

declarations.title: invert
